title: Install Go on Windows
body: - see: [Install Go on Windows and create and compile program](https://tanguay-eu.vercel.app/howtos/349)

title: Install Go on Linux
body: - see: [Install Go on a new Hetzner Debian machine and make universal executable Go program](https://tanguay-eu.vercel.app/howtos/865)

title: Create, run and compile a hello world
body:
- **main.go**
	-----------------------------------
	package main

	import "fmt"

	func main() {
		fmt.Println("Hello, World!")
	}
	-----------------------------------
- `go run main.go`
- `go build main.go`

title: Convert a slice of structs to JSON text and save to a JSON file
body:
- note that struct properties which are in PascalCase
- in Go, the visibility of struct fields
	- is determined by the capitalization of the first letter
	- this is a part of Go's conventions for exporting identifiers##gojsonsjosj

title: Find all files in current directory that have "string" in the name
body: - `find . -maxdepth 1 -name "*string*" -exec ls -ld {} +`##themaxdepthsdkf

title: Use the Go standard library template to create a website with variables from a struct
body: - you have to create a data object, then in the HTML, you have access to all of the properties##gowevtemplate

title: Create make file to more easily build a Go executable
body:
- "make build" will create the executable, "make clean" will delete it
- this worked on my Ubuntu without installing anything
- on Windows, even in Git Bash, make can't be found, installation is involved##createstheexecmake

title: Make a custom Go module on your GitHub which you can import into other projects
body:
- create a local Go project that has Go functions organized into files and publish it to a repository, e.g.
	- https://github.com/edwardtanguay/gotools##firstfunction
- set the project up up module with the name of the repository:
	- `go mod init github.com/edwardtanguay/gotools`
- create a new release on GitHub
	- "Releases"
	- "Created a new release"
	- enter tag version e.g. "v1.0.0"
	- enter title and description
	- "Publish release"
- create another project
	- create it as a module
		- `go mod init tanguay.info/02300-use-custom-module`
	- import and use a function in your custom module##importansdfususe
	- record the current version in your module file
		- `go mod tidy`##gotidsjdsy
- to upgrade to a new version
	- make change
	- on GitHub make a new release (must begin with "v", e.g. "v1.1.0")
	- go to new version URL at pkg.go.dev e.g. https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/edwardtanguay/gotools@v1.1.0
		- click button to upgrade, this make take a few minutes
	- in projects where you want to upgrade to the new version
		- `go mod tidy`
		- click and upgrade##theclickandup

title: Create two functions, one where changing the argument values change the external values and one where they do not change
body:
- BY VALUE: if you simply send a variable to a function e.g. Display, it receives a copy of the variable and so will not change the original variable sent
- BY REFERENCE: however if you send a variable POINTER to a function e.g. Update, then the original variable is changed
- note that the second case is how JavaScript objects behave by default, i.e. they are automatically sent by reference to functions##thethepersonpointer

title: Read SQLite database file and print out data from SQL table
body:
- note for mattn/go-sqlite3 to work, you have to have gcc installed
	- Linux:
		- `sudo apt update`
		- `sudo apt install build-essential`
	- Windows:
		- https://jmeubank.github.io/tdm-gcc/download
- get northwind.sqlite from here
	- https://edwardtanguay.vercel.app/share
	- search for "sqlite"##thesqlisjworking
